IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDescription: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES THEM FOR LIFE, WORK AND SERVICE. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS, CHAMINADE ENCOURAGES THE (SEE SCHEDULE O) DEVELOPMENT OF MORAL CHARACTER AND PERSONAL COMPETENCIES, AND THE COMMITMENT TO BUILD A JUST AND PEACEFUL SOCIETY. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS THE CIVIC AND CHURCH COMMUNITIES OF THE PACIFIC REGION ITS ACADEMIC AND INTELLECTUAL RESOURCES IN THE PURSUIT OF COMMON AIMS.
IRS990.Description: CHAMINADE OFFERS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES STUDENTS FOR LIFE, SERVICE AND SUCCESSFUL CAREERS. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS AND ACCREDITED BY THE WESTERN ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, CHAMINADE PROVIDES 2800 STUDENTS WITH 23 UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS, 7 GRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS AND SEVERAL DEGREE OPPORTUNITIES FOR WORKING ADULTS IN THE ACCELERATED ADULT EVENING PROGRAMS.

Activity2.Description: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES AT CHAMINADE INCLUDE A 400 STUDENT RESIDENCE HALL PROGRAM; DINING SERVICES FEATURING THE SILVERSWORD CAFE AND COURTYARD PATIO; NCAA PACIFIC WEST CONFERENCE DIVISION II ATHLETIC PROGRAM ANNUALLY HOSTING THE EA SPORTS MAUI INVITATIONAL BASKETBALL TOURNAMENT; CAMPUS BOOKSTORE; COPY CENTER AND MAIL SERVICES.

OtherLiabilities.Description: UNSECURED NOTES PAYABLE TO MARIANIST CENTER OF HAWAII

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: IN FYE JUNE 30, 2011, THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASED A FINE ART EDITION OF THE ST. JOHN'S BIBLE. THE BIBLE IS A WORK OF ART AND A WORK OF THEOLOGY. THE VISION AND VALUES OF THE BIBLE ARE TO IGNITE IMAGINATION, GLORIFY GOD'S WORD, REVIVE TRADITION, DISCOVER HISTORY, FOSTER THE ARTS, AND GIVE VOICE. THE ST. JOHN'S BIBLE, ON PUBLIC EXHIBITION, PROVIDES EDUCATION TO STUDENTS BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO EXPLORE THE VARIOUS SUBJECTS WRITTEN AND ILLUMINATED IN THE BIBLE. CHAMINADE PLANS TO USE THE BIBLE IN LITURGIES MARKING EVENTS OF GREATEST SIGNIFICANCE IN CAMPUS LIFE, SUCH AS GRADUATIONS AND INSTALLATIONS. CHAMINADE WILL ALSO MAKE IT AVAILABLE FOR USE BY THE DIOCESE OF HONOLULU FOR SIMILAR OCCASIONS, SUCH AS THE ANNUAL RED MASS FOR HAWAII'S POLITICAL LEADERS AND THE OPENING OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR MASS WITH THE CATHOLIC SCHOOL TEACHERS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND PROGRAM EXPENSES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011. INTEREST AND PENALTIES, IF ANY (NONE IN 2012 OR 2011), ARE INCLUDED IN INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT EXPENSES. AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, THE YEARS THAT REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES ARE 2008 AND THEREAFTER.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF: -34,387.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF -34,387.
TUITION DISCOUNTS & SCHOLARSHIPS 9,009,677. FEDERAL GRANTS 4,130,220. RENTAL EXPENSES -33,360. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES -33,174. COGS -921,238. ROUNDING 1.
TUITION DISCOUNTS & SCHOLARSHIPS 9,009,677. FEDERAL GRANTS NETTED AGAINST REVENUE 4,130,220. ROUNDING 1.

PART V, COLUMN (C): AMOUNTS WERE PREVIOUSLY ADJUSTED TO REFLECT REVISED FIGURES, AS REPORTED IN PRIOR YEAR AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMETS. AS SUCH, LINE 1G(D), THREE YEARS BACK END OF YEAR BALANCE, WILL NOT TIE TO LINE 1A(C), TWO YEARS BACK BEGINNING OF YEAR BALANCE.

Form990ScheduleEPartII.Explanation: "NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY" IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG, STUDENT HANDBOOK AND CHAMINADE WEBSITE (WWW.CHAMINADE.EDU)

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE SCHOOL PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS AGAINST TUITION INVOICES. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT ACTUALLY DISBURSED FROM THE SCHOOL.

Form990ScheduleKPartVI.Explanation: QUESTIONS 3D-3E AND 4D ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. AS SUCH, THEY HAVE BEEN MARKED NO.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: METHOD FOR DETERMINING NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED IN PART I, COLUMN (B). FOR PUBLICLY TRADED SECURITIES, EACH SEPARATE GIFT REPRESENTS AN ITEM.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990, PART V: QUESTIONS 7G AND 7H ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. AS SUCH, THEY HAVE BEEN MARKED NO.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A DRAFT OF THE 990 WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AT THEIR FEBRUARY 2013 MEETING FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FINALIZATION & FILING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR, IN JULY/AUGUST, THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE EMAILS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS TO EACH CURRENT MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS. FORMS ARE THEN SENT BACK TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE, WHO REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORMS AND TRACKS WHICH FORMS MAY STILL BE OUTSTANDING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT, THE BOARD NEGOTIATES THE CONTRACT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE UNIVERSITY LEGAL COUNSEL. FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES, COMPENSATION IS NEGOTIATED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY WHO CONSULTS WITH THE PERSONNEL OFFICE & COMPARES COMPENSATION WITH PEER INSTITUTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE & UPON REQUEST.

DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2012, CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY ENTERED INTO A LONG-TERM POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT TO PURCHASE THE ENERGY GENERATED BY A SOLAR ELECTRIC GENERATING FACILITY. MANAGEMENT HAS RECOGNIZED A CAPITAL LEASE FOR THE ESTIMATED PAYMENTS RELATED TO THE SYSTEM. ALTHOUGH FOR TAX PURPOSES THE AGREEMENT WOULD NOT FALL UNDER THE DEFINITION OF A CAPITAL LEASE, THE POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT WILL BE ACCOUNTED FOR AS A CAPITAL LEASE ON THE FORM 990 IN KEEPING WITH THE BOOKS AND RECORDS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET UNREALIZED LOSSES ON INVESTMENTS: -471,899. CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF: -34,387. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: -506,286.
FORM 990, PART XII, LINE 2C: THE OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
